unnormalised: Alright folks, buckle up because the Indian auto scene is hotter than a Chennai summer! This week has seen more vehicle launches than you can shake a stick at.
normalised: Alright folks, buckle up because the Indian auto scene is hotter than a Chennai summer! This week has seen more vehicle launches than you can shake a stick at.

unnormalised: First off, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the much-anticipated "Breeza 2.0" with a revamped engine and, get this, a sunroof! Early reviews are calling it a "Paisa Vasool" deal. Prices start around Rs. 8 Lakh.
normalised: First off, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the much anticipated "Breeza two point zero" with a revamped engine and, get this, a sunroof! Early reviews are calling it a "Paisa Vasool" deal. Prices start around rupee eight lakh.

unnormalised: Then, Tata Motors jumped into the EV game with their "Nexon EV Max+", promising a whopping 450 km range on a single charge. Dr. Sharma from ARAI was spotted checking it out – must be legit!
normalised: Then, Tata Motors jumped into the E V game with their "Nexon E V Max plus", promising a whopping four hundred and fifty kilometer range on a single charge. Doctor Sharma from A R A I was spotted checking it out – must be legit!

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! Mahindra rolled out a souped-up version of the Thar, with extra off-roading capabilities. Perfect for those weekend trips to Ladakh, eh?
normalised: But wait, there's more! Mahindra rolled out a souped up version of the Thar, with extra off roading capabilities. Perfect for those weekend trips to Ladakh, eh?

unnormalised: And finally, for the luxury lovers, Mercedes-Benz launched their new S-Class Maybach in Mumbai. We're talking self-driving features and legroom that rivals a small apartment (estimated 100 sq ft per passenger!). The price? Well, let’s just say you’ll need Ambani levels of wealth to even sniff at it. Keep an eye out for our full reviews!
normalised: And finally, for the luxury lovers, Mercedes Benz launched their new S Class Maybach in Mumbai. We're talking self driving features and legroom that rivals a small apartment (estimated one hundred square feet per passenger!). The price? Well, let’s just say you’ll need Ambani levels of wealth to even sniff at it. Keep an eye out for our full reviews!
